title: (x) Looking for an alternative to Eurostile extended - various {gang}
content: I am looking for an alternative to Eurostile extended. Any idea ?
author: docunagi

comments.content:
Try Max from FontFont by Morten Olsen. I think it's a cool and modern alternative to Eurostile...

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/max/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/max/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/max/")

[FF Max](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=ff%20max) is definitely a great Eurostile alt, but for that width I'd look at (in order)  
 [Stainless](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FB.112002.0.0), [FF QType](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=FF%20QType), [Register](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=register), [FF Trademarker](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11132.0.0), [Aggie](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.123594.0.0), and [Kamaro](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=GF.112195.0.0).
thanks so much for that :) fast and reliable as always !!!

If you're not completely sick of the sight of it, hows about good old Bank Gothic?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bank-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bank-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bank-gothic/")

Definitely Microgramma, which is what granfathered and inspired Eurostile, but way better with more variations. People confuse them all the time, but this was the one seen all over the place in the 50's-70's, especially in industrial trends.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma/")
FF Trademarker reminds me of another possibility: [Serpentine](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/).

(These may be too different from eurostile extended...)

[Signa](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/signa-extended/)  
 [Batory](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t4typography/batory/wide/)  
 [Armchair](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_armchair.html)  
 [Zeppelin](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/) (the wide ones)

Nick Shinn's [Panoptica Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20120112084708/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/panoptica/) will give you a nice wide unicase option, in three weights.

- Mike Yanega
